content: The Bihar cadre IGP, M. Sunil Kumar Naik, was arrested on Monday in a case of alleged custodial torture of K. Raghu Ramakrishna Raju, the current Dy Speaker of A.P. Assembly, five years ago when he was an MP

As they shout, ‚Äòthe gun and bullets government will not be allowed to run‚Äô, taunting them, the Chief Minister says the NDA has 2002 members in the Assembly

title: Now khata changes for farmlands in Karnataka can be done through mobiles
content: The auto mutation system launched by the Revenue Department provides for farmers to apply for change in khatas through online method

title: Lab reports on Rajamahendravaram milk adulteration case expected this week, says official
content: Investigation points to the contamination of milk with ethylene glycol, which is used as a coolant during the milk chilling process, says Health and Family Welfare Commissioner

content: RSS, BJP trying to control what people eat, how they live, whose culture is considered ‚Äòacceptable‚Äô, he says; restrictions citing ‚Äúsocial harmony‚Äù disproportionately hurt OBCs, Dalits, Adivasis, and minorities

content: The decision will not only boost jute production and quality, but will also increase the income of farmers, says Modi

content: Experts to discuss technology, productivity and value addition for global competitiveness in cashew sector

content: The festival, which has celebrated the rich heritage of Indian classical music since 1914, features a diverse lineup of performances by Mathangi Satyamoorthy, Sukumari Narendra Menon,Vellinezhi Subramanian, Sukumari Narendra Menon, among others.

title: BJP turns to influential Christian faces in central Travancore for Assembly poll
content: Party is banking on the possibility of a swing in Catholic voting patterns. The strategy now being rolled out involves fielding prominent Christian faces in key Christian-dominated constituencies across the region

title: Malabar Cancer Centre‚Äôs ‚ÄôAI for oncology‚Äô initiative earns national recognition at India AI Summit 2026
content: The project is designed to rapidly analyse patient treatment data and support clinicians in making precise, evidence-based decisions

title: Collector takes serious note of maternal deaths in Chittoor
content: Directs medical and paramedical staff to ensure every cadre of the medical and health department strictly adheres to assigned responsibilities and continuously monitors pregnant women from conception to institutional delivery

title: Job aspirants put up a massive protest in Dharwad
content: High drama as protestors gherao police personnel and also shout ‚ÄòGo Back‚Äô slogans against the Opposition BJP leaders

title: CAG finds lapses in Jal Jeevan Mission implementation in Kerala
content: CAG report reveals significant lapses in Kerala‚Äôs Jal Jeevan Mission implementation, highlighting target shortfalls and geo-tagging errors.

title: Iran's war calculus: Why Khamenei is betting on Trump for his regime's survival
content: The United States has built up one of its largest Middle East deployments in years, with two aircraft carriers moving into position and additional warships and aircraft arriving in the region. The State Department has also begun thinning out exposed outposts. Meanwhile, Iran is preparing itself for a protracted war with US. It is dispersing authority, hardening infrastructure, rehearsing retaliation, tightening internal security, and signaling that it can raise global costs through Hormuz and regional targeting.

title: Defence, trade and Hexagon alliance: What to expect during PM Modi's high-stakes Israel visit
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will visit Israel on February 25-26. He will meet prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu to discuss defence, security, and economic ties. The leaders will also review progress in science, technology, and innovation. The visit aims to reaffirm the strategic partnership between India and Israel. Discussions will also cover regional developments and people-to-people exchanges.

title: 2 crashes in a month: Govt mulls safety ranking of charter operators
content: Following two fatal charter aircraft crashes, India's aviation regulator is introducing a safety ranking for non-scheduled operators. Operators must now disclose critical safety information online, and stricter penalties will be imposed for violations. The DGCA is enforcing a zero-tolerance policy, holding senior leadership accountable for safety lapses.

title: Sam Altman issues blunt warning at IIT-Delhi, says: You should not trust me for ...
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman advised young Indians against solely relying on traditional career advice, emphasizing the need to develop and trust their own intuition in the rapidly changing AI era. He acknowledged that while some jobs will disappear, new ones will emerge, and encouraged risk-taking, stating his own willingness to fail has led to success.

title: Toilet trouble: US troops feel the 'pressure' as Trump vows to flush out Khamenei regime
content: America's most advanced aircraft carrier, the USS Gerald R Ford, is grappling with persistent sewage system failures during its extended deployment near the Middle East. Despite the Navy's assurances of operational readiness, the $13 billion vessel's next-generation plumbing struggles with waste from its 4,600-strong crew, leading to frequent clogs and demanding 19-hour shifts for engineers.

title: PAK vs ENG: Pakistan fan's hilarious reaction after Saim Ayub dismissal goes viral - Watch
content: A Pakistan fan‚Äôs appalled reaction after Saim Ayub was dismissed for 7 by Jofra Archer went viral during the T20 World Cup match against England. Pakistan scored 164/9, with Sahibzada Farhan top-scoring with 63 and Fakhar Zaman adding 25. Liam Dawson took three wickets as England kept pressure with regular breakthroughs, while Babar Azam made a slow 25.

title: IBM‚Äôs rout, 'ghost' GDP: Why AI doom loop may be just a 'scary bedtime story'
content: Markets were rattled after a report projected a 2028 worldwide intelligence crisis, claiming AI would decimate professional roles and spark economic freefall, leading to a steep drop in IBM‚Äôs share price. Yet many specialists dispute this doomsday timeline, arguing that AI‚Äôs impact will unfold more gradually, with outcomes depending significantly on how policymakers manage labor, regulation, and innovation.

title: Candace Owens sparks backlash with ‚ÄúBride of Charlie‚Äù series on Erika Kirk
content: Candace Owens has stirred major controversy after releasing the trailer for her YouTube investigative series The Bride of Charlie, centered on Erika Kirk. The preview quickly went viral, prompting backlash, intense online debate, and questions directed at Charlie Kirk‚Äôs allies. While supporters call it accountability journalism, critics warn it risks harassment and speculation, as silence from prominent conservative voices fuels growing tension.

title: Sarma vs Gogoi: How a decade-old Cong rift turned into Assam's fiercest political war
content: Assam's political landscape is heating up as Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma and Congress leader Gaurav Gogoi trade sharp accusations. The ongoing war of words between both the leaders has turned into a major political showdown. What began over a decade ago as a rift within the Congress has now become one of the most bitter political rivalries.

title: IBM stock‚Äôs worst single-day drop in 25 yrs over Anthropic tool
content: IBM shares plummeted after AI startup Anthropic announced its tool can automate COBOL modernization, threatening IBM's core mainframe business. This AI advancement could compress years-long, costly migration projects into months, impacting recurring revenue from hardware, software, and services. The market reacted swiftly, signaling a potential shift in the legacy IT services landscape.

title: Drugged & assaulted: How 2 sisters ran a rape-conversion racket in Bhopal
content: Police have registered two FIRs for rape and forced religious conversion against a gang in Bhopal. Two women, one from Chhattisgarh and another from Bhopal, were allegedly lured with job offers, then sexually exploited and pressured to convert. Three individuals, including the alleged mastermind Razia, have been arrested as investigations continue.

title: Will India venue ticket holders get refunds if Pakistan reach T20 World Cup semis and final?
content: Tickets for the T20 World Cup semi-finals and final went on sale, but venues may change depending on Pakistan and Sri Lanka‚Äôs qualification. If Pakistan reach the semis or final, matches will shift to Colombo, with refunds for Kolkata and Ahmedabad ticket holders. Sri Lanka‚Äôs scenario could also move the first semi-final to Colombo. Fans will get refunds if their venue doesn‚Äôt host the match.

title: Caitlin Clark excited over former teammate Gabbie Marshall's engagement
content: Indiana Fever star Caitlin Clark excitedly celebrated former Iowa teammate Gabbie Marshall‚Äôs engagement to Spencer Touro on social media. The longtime Hawkeyes backcourt partners remain close friends after leading Iowa to major success together. While Clark shines in the WNBA, Marshall pursued academics, earning a master‚Äôs degree in occupational therapy and beginning a new chapter.

title: Sidney Crosby injury worries Pittsburgh Penguins after Olympics
content: The case of lower-body injury on Sidney Crosby when Team Canada is on the run to the Olympics has brought about new worries in the mind of the Pittsburgh Penguins. He has missed the gold medal game with Team USA, and there is still speculation over whether he would be back in the NHL. There is a minor knee problem, according to medical opinion, but Pittsburgh is working out contingency plans as the regular season program gains strength.

title: After Amma: AIADMK's struggle to fill the void left by Jayalalithaa
content: Nearly a decade after J Jayalalithaa's death, the AIADMK struggles to regain its dominance, battling leadership disputes and electoral defeats. As Tamil Nadu heads to the 2026 assembly polls, the party, now led by Edappadi Palaniswami, seeks to overcome the void left by 'Amma' and forge alliances to challenge the ruling DMK.

title: ‚ÄòRoot out enemies and traitors‚Äô: Sasikala floats new political party ahead of Tamil Nadu elections
content: Expelled AIADMK leader VK Sasikala has announced the formation of a new political party in Tamil Nadu, vowing to champion the cause of the poor and downtrodden. Unveiling a flag featuring prominent Dravidian leaders, she stated the party would follow their ideology. Sasikala also recalled being urged to become Chief Minister after Jayalalithaa's demise.

title: Hilarious Babar Azam memes take over internet after another flop show in T20 World Cup
content: Babar Azam‚Äôs poor T20 World Cup form continued with a slow 25 off 24 against England, sparking memes online. Pakistan made 164/9, with Sahibzada Farhan scoring 63. England bowlers kept things tight. Coach Mike Hesson said Babar was picked for stability in the middle order, not powerplay hitting, but fans still mocked his struggles in the tournament.

title: Rinku Singh rushes back home due to medical emergency in family
content: India batter Rinku Singh has returned home due to a family medical emergency, as his father‚Äôs health has worsened during cancer treatment. He missed India‚Äôs training session in Chennai and there is no clarity on when he will rejoin the squad, which may force team management to consider replacements. The rest of the Indian team trained as usual ahead of their T20 World Cup matches.

title: After Keralam, Bangla? Mamata renews demand for name change; attacks BJP
content: The Union Cabinet approved Kerala's name change to Keralam. This sparked a political row. West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee questioned why her state's proposal to be renamed Bangla is pending. She accused the Centre of discrimination. The Centre's decision comes ahead of assembly elections in both states.

title: 'I am not supportive of that': Gukesh slams Kramnik over cheating claims
content: World champion D Gukesh criticised Vladimir Kramnik‚Äôs cheating allegations, saying cheating has been made a bigger issue than it is. While firmly against unethical play, Gukesh said he does not support Kramnik‚Äôs approach and called for harmony in chess. The 19-year-old spoke ahead of the Prague International Chess Festival, where he hopes to regain form.

title: 'We're 2002': Nitish Kumar's big slip as he loses cool on oppn in assembly - watch
content: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar lost his composure in the assembly amidst opposition protests alleging rule by "guns and bullets." He mistakenly stated the NDA's strength as "two thousand and two" instead of 202. The protest began over a police baton charge on village chowkidars demanding higher stipends.

title: Iran ups the ante: Tehran finalising deal to buy Chinese anti-ship cruise missiles
content: Iran is reportedly close to finalizing a deal with China for advanced CM-302 supersonic anti-ship missiles, a move that could significantly bolster its naval defense capabilities. The potential transfer comes amid heightened US naval presence and escalating tensions in the region, potentially complicating American efforts to curb Iran's military programs.

title: Mayank Pawar's Death: Splitsvilla 7 star dies at 37 in Mumbai; prayer meet on Feb 25
content: Splitsvilla 7 fame Mayank Pawar has passed away in Mumbai at the age of 37. The reality star and bodybuilding champion's sudden death has deeply shocked fans and the fitness industry. The exact cause of his passing remains unconfirmed, with a prayer meeting scheduled for February 25, 2026.

title: 'Should play Kohli's role': India batter asked to 'become a chase master'
content: Mohammed Kaif advised Tilak Varma to ignore criticism and stick to his natural anchor role in the T20 World Cup 2026. Tilak struggled with form and failed when he tried to play aggressively against South Africa. Kaif said Tilak should play like Virat Kohli and focus on batting deep, since India already has many attacking players. Tilak is expected to play in India‚Äôs key match against Zimbabwe.

title: 'Scrap US trade deal': Rahul dares PM Modi; repeats 'sold India' claim
content: Rahul Gandhi claimed Union minister Hardeep Puri's name in the infamous Epstein files was released to "threaten" the PM, and that there are "videos and messages which have not been released from the millions of Epstein files" held up in the US. In another allegation, Rahul claimed that the case against Adani in the United States is not against the industrialist but against PM Modi.‚Äã‚Äã

title: Major blow for India! Captain skips fielding after injury, doubt over next match
content: India suffered a setback in the first ODI against Australia as captain Harmanpreet Kaur injured her knee while batting and did not field, with Smriti Mandhana leading instead. Harmanpreet scored 53, while Mandhana made 58, but India were restricted to 214. Australia chased it easily, winning by six wickets to lead 1-0. Beth Mooney starred with 76 as India now await Harmanpreet‚Äôs fitness update.

title: Kerala now Keralam: Centre gives nod for name change; Tharoor quips, ‚ÄòKeralamite, Keralamian‚Äô?
content: The Union Cabinet has approved renaming Kerala to 'Keralam', following a state assembly resolution. This move, aimed at reflecting the name in Malayalam, has sparked a linguistic debate. Senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor humorously questioned the new terms for residents, asking how people from the state now would be referred to, and what happens to terms like ‚ÄúKeralite and Keralan‚Äù.

title: Watch: Zelenskyy reveals his 'base' in Kyiv; taunts Putin - watch
content: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy revealed the Kyiv bunker where he directed the nation's initial war response, recalling US President Biden's offer to evacuate him. He famously replied, 'I need ammunition, not a ride.

title: 'Good news will come': Sasikala hints at new political party ahead of Tamil Nadu polls
content: Former AIADMK leader VK Sasikala has hinted at launching a new political party, making the announcement during an event commemorating former chief minister Jayalalithaa's birth anniversary. She said, "Good news will come". This potential move could introduce a three-way contest in the upcoming Tamil Nadu Assembly elections, alongside the existing DMK and BJP-AIADMK alliances.

title: PM Modi meets Manipur CM, his two deputies in New Delhi
content: BJP's Yumnam Khemchand Singh was sworn in as CM of Manipur on February 4, reinstating the NDA government along with Kuki legislator Nemcha Kipgen and Naga MLA Losii Dikho as his deputies, marking a fresh spin on shared governance in a multi-ethnic state riven by the Meitei-Kuki conflict. Governor AK Bhalla also administered the oath of office to BJP's Konthoujam Govindas and Khuraijam Loken Singh of NPP as cabinet ministers at the Lok Bhavan ceremony.

title: UPSC extends CSE 2026 deadline after portal issues ‚Äî check application dates & details
content: The Union Public Service Commission has extended the application deadline for Civil Services Examination 2026 and Indian Forest Service Examination 2026 until February 27, 2026, 6 pm, after technical issues affected the online portal due to heavy traffic. The recruitment will fill 933 vacancies through Preliminary, Main and interview stages. Eligibility requires a bachelor‚Äôs degree and age between 21 and 32 years. Serving IAS, IPS and IFS officers cannot reapply unless they resign.

title: 5 Pakistani cops killed in coordinated militant attack in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa
content: No group immediately claimed responsibility for the assault, which appeared to be carefully timed to target responding officers. The violence came just a day after another deadly episode in nearby Karak. On Monday, attackers used an explosives-laden drone to hit a paramilitary post, injuring several personnel. As the wounded were being transported for treatment, the assailants ambushed two ambulances.

title: Saudi Arabia opens domestic Hajj 2026 registration: Eligibility, dates & steps you need to know
content: Saudi Arabia has opened Hajj 1447 AH (2026) registration for citizens and residents inside the Kingdom via the Nusuk platform. Priority is given to first-time pilgrims, with package bookings commencing soon. Applicants must meet age and health requirements, with residents needing a valid permit of over one year.

title: In Pics: Zelensky Aged Visibly By War's Toll, Putin Frozen Exactly Since 2022
content: The contrast between Volodymyr Zelensky and Vladimir Putin is one of the most defining visual stories of the war itself.

title: How A Pakistani Judge With Fake Law Degree Served The High Court For 5 Years
content: A judge from Pakistan served in the Islamabad High Court (IHC), delivering judgements without anyone discovering that he held a fake law degree.

title: Poll Body, State Panels Adopt National Declaration For Unified Voter Rolls
content: The National Round Table Conference of the Election Commission of India and State Election Commissioners concluded in New Delhi with the adoption of the National Declaration 2026.

title: A Month After Crash Killed Ajit Pawar, 4 VSR Aviation Aircraft Grounded
content: The civil aviation regulator has ordered the grounding of four aircraft operated by VSR Ventures Pvt Ltd, a non-scheduled aircraft operator, following a special safety audit conducted after the Learjet 45 crash in Maharashtra's Baramati.

title: "Signing Off": 22-Year-Old Andhra Engineering Student's Suicide In Hostel
content: A 22-year-old engineering student died by suicide in a private hostel in Andhra Pradesh's Tirupati on Tuesday.

title: How Telangana Got Maoist Devji, Underground For 40 Years, To Surrender
content: In a major success for the Telangana Police, four senior commanders of the banned CPI (Maoist) surrendered before the Director General of Police B Shivdhar Reddy.

title: After Surge In Aviation Accidents, Regulator Tightens Rules For Non-Scheduled Operators
content: The civil aviation regulator DGCA announced a series of safety measures for non-scheduled operators (NSOPs) following a high-level meeting to address a recent surge in aviation incidents.

title: 28-Year-Old Woman Raped By 7, Made To Transfer Rs 10,000 In Assam Shocker
content: A 28-year-old woman was allegedly raped by multiple men at knifepoint while she went for an evening out with her boyfriend. According to reports, the men later extorted money from the victim.

title: 1st Round Of India-Israel Free Trade Talks Begins Ahead Of PM Modi's Visit
content: The first round of negotiations for the India-Israel Free Trade Agreement (FTA) commenced in New Delhi and is scheduled to take place until 26 February 2026.

title: "Any Gold Left In Sabarimala?": Supreme Court To Accused Who Sought Bail
content: Pankaj Bhandhari, accused in the Sabarimala gold theft case, was pulled up by the Supreme Court today when he applied for bail. "Is there any gold left in Sabarimala?" said Justice Satish Chandra Sharma.

title: PM Modi To Visit Israel Tomorrow To Boost Strategic Partnership
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will undertake a two-day visit to Israel beginning Wednesday to shore up bilateral defence and trade cooperation amid the ongoing tensions in the Middle-east including deteriorating ties between the US and Iran.

title: India-Bangladesh Bus Service Restarts After 18 Months As BNP Comes To Power
content: After a gap of nearly 18 months, the international Maitree bus service on the Agartala-Dhaka-Kolkata and Kolkata-Dhaka-Agartala routes has resumed, marking a significant step in restoring cross-border connectivity between India and Bangladesh.

title: Mamata Banerjee's "Anti-Bengali" Charge At Centre As Kerala Becomes Keralam
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, congratulating Kerala on its name change, said today that despite her best efforts, the Centre is not allowing a change of name for her state since it is anti-Bengal.

title: Anti-Pollution Body Flags Contamination In Vegetables In Bengaluru, Other Areas
content: A recent study by the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) has raised concerns about food safety in Bengaluru, revealing heavy metal contamination and excessive pesticide residues in vegetables sold across the city.

title: Inside Netanyahu's 'Hexagon' Of Alliances And Why He Wants India In It
content: As Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Israel visit begins on Wednesday, his Israeli counterpart, Benjamin Netanyahu, announced that his trip will forge a new alliance to counter what he described as "radical" adversaries.

title: Mumbai Airport Voted Asia-Pacific's Best Airport For Departures
content: Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport has been recognised as Asia-Pacific's Best Airport for departures in the over 40-million passengers' category.

title: Tata Sons Board Defers Decision On N Chandrasekaran's 3rd Term: Report
content: The board of Tata Sons on Tuesday deferred a decision on the re-appointment of Natarajan Chandrasekaran for a third term as Chairman.

title: Target EPS Ahead Of Assembly Polls, Sasikala To Launch Political Party
content: In a dramatic political move ahead of the Tamil Nadu Assembly election, expelled AIADMK leader VK Sasikala has announced that she will launch her own party and field candidates - a direct challenge to AIADMK chief Edappadi K. Palaniswami.

title: Stones, Abuses, Then Dog Drew First Blood: How Jaish Terrorist Saifullah Was Killed In J&K
content: Saifullah -- the most wanted Jaish commander from Pakistan -- who had been evading security forces for months, was finally tracked down through drone surveillance.

title: Drunk Driver Goes On Rampage In Tamil Nadu, Rams Shops, Vehicles
content: A man, allegedly under the influence of alcohol, drove his car recklessly outside a bus terminus in Tamil Nadu's Ramanathapuram district on Monday.

title: Top 25 rankings, play of the week and what to watch

title: Hooked on hockey after the Olympics? An updated look at the NHL's playoff picture
content: the NHL paused its season to allow its players to compete in the 2026 winter Olympics in Italy . around 143 players saw action in the Olympic men's hockey tournament . some return as bitter runners-ups, others as new minted gold medalists .

title: Week 3 Top 25 and how to watch
content: Sophia Knight was named SEC Player of the Week after going 11-for-13 last week . she has recorded eight multi-hit games and is hitting .543 through the first 14 games of the season . here is the complete scoreboard here to stay up to date this spring .

title: Olympic standouts, disappointments from all 32 NHL teams
content: the 2026 Olympic men's hockey tournament ended in thrilling fashion . both teams were comprised of players -- many of them superstars . all but one of the countries had at least one active NHL player on the roster . it's time to assess which players will be coming home content with how they performed .

title: Kings of the hot corner: Buster Olney ranks baseball's best third basemen
content: we rank the best of the best at third base . we will roll out a position per day over the next two weeks . the goal of this exercise is to identify the best players for the 2026 season, not who might be best in five years or over their career.

title: USA Basketball's road to 2028: New era, new coach, new decisions
content: in 2024, a team USA squad full of stars, role players, up-and-comers and legends survived two thrillers . a 95-91 win over Nikola Jokic -led Serbia squad and an exhausting 98-87 clincher over host France . it doesn't appear that USA Basketball's graybearded Avengers will reassemble to chase a sixth consecutive gold .

title: No one loves late drama like Liverpool. What's behind their taste for theatrics?
content: arsenal beat Nottingham Forest 1-0 in the premier league on sunday afternoon . the win is the latest dramatic installment in a campaign characterized by last-gasp winners . it is a quirk that has inflicted both joy and misery on head coach arne slot's side .
